sen.j: 法華宗本門流（ほっけしゅうほんもんりゅう）は、日蓮を宗祖とし、日隆 (法華宗本門流)を派祖とする、日蓮門下の一派である。
sen.e: The Hokke Sect Honmon Lineage is a denomination of Nichiren Buddhism for which the sect founder considered to be Nichiren and the school founder believed to be Nichiryu.
The Hokke Sect Honmon Lineage is a denomination of Nichiren Buddhism for which the sect founder is considered to be Nichiren and the school founder is believed to be Nichiryu.
The Hokke Sect of Honmon School is a denomination of Nichiren Buddhism for which the sect founder is considered to be Nichiren and the school founder is believed to be Nichiryu.

sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 日隆 (法華宗本門流)は妙顕寺（京都府）日霽を師として修学したが、法華経について論争があり、日隆 (法華宗本門流)は「八品正意論」を提唱し、妙顕寺（京都府）を出て本能寺（京都府）を建立し、日隆門流を興す。
sen.e: Nichiryu (Hokke Sect Honomn Lineage founder) studied under Nissai of Myoken-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) but had a dispute regarding the Lotus Sutra, which caused him to advocate "Happon Seiiron", leave Myoken-ji Temple and establish Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) where he founded the Nichiryu School.

Nichiryu (Hokke Sect Honomn Lineage founder) studied under Nissai of Myoken-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) but had a dispute regarding the Lotus Sutra, which caused him to advocate "Happon Seiiron", leave Myoken-ji Temple and establish Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) where he founded the Nichiryu School.

Nichiryu (Hokke Sect of Honmon School founder) studied under Nissai of Myoken-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) but had a dispute regarding Hokke-kyo (the Lotus Sutra), which caused him to advocate 'Happon Shoi ron' (theory that eight chapters of Hokke-kyo (Lotus Sutra) are the true teachings of Nichiren), leave Myoken-ji Temple and establish Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) where he founded the Nichiryumon School.

sen.j: 1415年（応永22年）に日隆 (法華宗本門流)は本能寺（京都府）を建立する。
1872年（明治5年）に一宗一管長制により、日隆門流は日蓮門下の諸門流と連合する。
sen.e: 1872: The Nichiren School united with all other schools in the Nichiren denomination as a result of a system in which each sect was allowed only one chief abbot.
1872: The Nichiren School united with all other schools in the Nichiren denomination as a result of a system in which each sect was allowed only one chief abbot.
1872: The Nichiryumon School united with all other schools in the Nichiren denomination as a result of a system in which each sect was allowed only one chief abbot.

sen.j: 1874年（明治7年）に日隆門流は日蓮宗勝劣派に属する。
sen.e: 1874: Nichiryu School become part of the Nichiren Sect Shoretsu School.
1874: Nichiryu School become part of the Nichiren Sect Shoretsu School.
1874: Nichiryumon School become part of the Shoretsu School of the Nichiren Sect.
sen.cmt: 勝劣派は、Shoretsu Schoolとし表記を変えました。

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）に管長設置により、日隆門流は八品派と公称し、日蓮宗勝劣派は解体する。
sen.e: 1876: The Nichiryu School became the Happon School and separated from the Nichiren Sect Shoretsu School.
1876: The Nichiryu School became the Happon School and separated from the Nichiren Sect Shoretsu School.
1876: The Nichiryumon School called themselves the Happon School and separated from the Shoretsu School of the Nichiren Sect.
sen.cmt: 八品派は、Happon Schoolとし、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）に八品派は本門法華宗と改称する。
sen.e: 1898: The Happon School was renamed to the Honmon Hokke Sect.
1898: The Happon School was renamed to the Honmon Hokke Sect.
1898: The Happon School was renamed to the Honmon Hokke Sect.

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）に宗教団体法により、本門法華宗と本妙法華宗と法華宗が合同し、法華宗と公称する。
sen.e: 1941: The Honmon Hokke Sect and Honmyo Hokke Sect combined to form the Hokke Sect.
1941: The Honmon Hokke Sect and Honmyo Hokke Sect combined to form the Hokke Sect.
1941: The Honmon Hokke Sect and Honmyo Hokke Sect combined to form the Hokke Sect.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）に光長寺（静岡県）、鷲山寺（千葉県）、本能寺（京都府）、本興寺 (尼崎市)（兵庫県）が法華宗から独立し、法華宗本門流と公称する。
sen.e: 1951: Kocho-ji Temple (Shizuoka Prefecture), Jusen-ji Temple (Chiba Prefecture), Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and Honko-ji Temple (Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture) became independent from the Hokke Sect and formed the Hokke Sect Honmon Lineage.

1951: Kocho-ji Temple (Shizuoka Prefecture), Jusen-ji Temple (Chiba Prefecture), Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and Honko-ji Temple (Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture) became independent from the Hokke Sect and formed the Hokke Sect Honmon Lineage.

1951: Kocho-ji Temple (Shizuoka Prefecture), Jusen-ji Temple (Chiba Prefecture), Honno-ji Temple (Kyoto Prefecture) and Honko-ji Temple (Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture) became independent from the Hokke Sect and formed the Honmon School of Hokke Sect.
